element.name: Don't Panic! by AbbeyAckbar, Traditional Cache (2.5/1)

long-description.p: The cache is located in Father Collins Park. The park was selected as one of the seven landmark projects in sustainability for Dublin City Council. The park was named after a much respected local parish priest who was instrumental in its original acquisition for development as a public park. An international design competition for the park was held in 2003. The Fr. Collins Park project began in September 2007 and was designed by the Argentinean architects Abelleyro & Romero.

The park was officially opened on 27th May 2009 and is Ireland’s first "sustainable park" with five 50KW wind turbines set in along a water feature.
They harness the wind and provide the energy that powers the public lighting, maintenance depots, football club changing rooms, aeration and water features. The turbine rotor diameter is 15 metres, and the overall height to blade tip is 32.5 metres. They will save an estimated 320 tonnes of CO2 per year.

a skate-park :
A plaza design skate park, the first of its type and size in Ireland, was designed for street skaters using 3 levels containing a variety of steps, edges, straight lines and grind rails

2 playgrounds :
The surfaces on the two playgrounds were made from recycled runners!
picnic areas with outdoor chess/draughts boards

Cache Info:
The difficulty level is subject to change depending on how easy (or not) it is for people to find. The park is accessible during park opening times only, which is 10:00 to dusk. There is an FTF prize of a pathtag (located at the back of the container)
Don't panic and DON'T press the button either (the cache is not on it) unless of course you need to, (Not being able to locate the cache doesn't count : ) )

ul.li:
2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by Alastair74
Found with Wildfowler while spending the day in Dublin for the WWFM. TFTC

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by WeeBookWorm
Found when out with my dad (Frezeluberz), gilliancclarke (and her two geo-sprogs) & Zoe andDaddy TFTC

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by CheekyCheetah
Found when out with my dad (Frezeluberz), gilliancclarke (and her two geo-sprogs) & Zoe andDaddy TFTC

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by wildfowler
Found on a caching weekend around Dublin with Alastair74! TNLNSL TFTC

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by Frezeluberz
Uh-huh Gill ... saying nothing about your proximity to the cache on this one. Still with Wildflower & Alastair74 doing this one. Cache was found quickly with no problems. TFTC.

wpt.name: GC1VCEP
wpt.desc: Don't Panic! by AbbeyAckbar, Traditional Cache (2.5/1)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Don't Panic!
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The cache is located in Father Collins Park. The park was selected as one of the seven landmark projects in sustainability for Dublin City Council. The park was named after a much respected local parish priest who was instrumental in its original acquisition for development as a public park. An international design competition for the park was held in 2003. The Fr. Collins Park project began in September 2007 and was designed by the Argentinean architects Abelleyro & Romero.

The park was officially opened on 27th May 2009 and is Ireland’s first "sustainable park" with five 50KW wind turbines set in along a water feature.
They harness the wind and provide the energy that powers the public lighting, maintenance depots, football club changing rooms, aeration and water features. The turbine rotor diameter is 15 metres, and the overall height to blade tip is 32.5 metres. They will save an estimated 320 tonnes of CO2 per year.

Features of the park include:

a skate-park :
A plaza design skate park, the first of its type and size in Ireland, was designed for street skaters using 3 levels containing a variety of steps, edges, straight lines and grind rails

2 playgrounds :
The surfaces on the two playgrounds were made from recycled runners!

6 playing pitches

picnic areas with outdoor chess/draughts boards

6 health/workout stations

a running/cycling track.

Cache Info:
The difficulty level is subject to change depending on how easy (or not) it is for people to find. The park is accessible during park opening times only, which is 10:00 to dusk. There is an FTF prize of a pathtag (located at the back of the container)
Don't panic and DON'T press the button either (the cache is not on it) unless of course you need to, (Not being able to locate the cache doesn't count : ) )
